metadata.Title: CVE-2021-37969 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in Google Updater in Google Chrome on Windows prior to 94.0.4606.54 allowed a remote attacker to perform local privilege escalation via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
